intro: Xanthisma drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Xanthisma drummondii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
